Idioms.definition: Which means, i am ready to participate.

Idioms.phrase: If it's not one thing, it's another
Idioms.definition: Which means, said after more than one thing goes wrong.
Which means, to be in a partnership with, often for unscrupulous purposes.
Which means, in a few words. Concisely stated.
Which means, to be easily successful, especially concerning sex or romance.
Which means, in an uncertain situation, over which you have no control (a reference to the state of being outside both heaven and hell).
Which means, something that is secured.
Which means, naked.

Idioms.phrase: In the heat of the moment
Idioms.definition: Which means, in an overwhelming situation, causing you to act rashly.
Which means, jointly facing the same predicament.
Which means, aggressive confrontation.
Which means, a crime committed by or with the help of someone living or working in the place that it took place.

Idioms.phrase: It never rains but it pours
Idioms.definition: Which means, when troubles come they often come together.
Which means, it takes two people to cause a problem between them.
Which means, said when people meet unexpectedly, away from their usual haunts.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for gone wrong.
Which means, said of something that isn't complex or difficult to understand.
Which means, the joint name given to Columbia, Brown, Cornell, Dartmouth, Yale, Pennsylvania, Princeton, and Harvard universities.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for dancing.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for car.
Which means, an overweight person.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for piddle.
Which means, tricking me.
Which means, join a popular trend.
Which means, introduce a ridiculous or unbelievable plot device into a TV series in order to boost flagging ratings.
Which means, the result which is deserved. A reward for what has been done - good or bad.
Which means, observe carefully to make sure something bad isn't done.
Which means, keep something away.
Which means, earn sufficient money in order to keep yourself alive.
Which means, remain positive in a tough situation.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for arse.
Which means, die.

Idioms.phrase: Kill two birds with one stone
Idioms.definition: Which means, accomplish two things with a single action.
Which means, a quick and automatic response.
Which means, sexual intercourse between two people standing up.
Which means, knuckle tapping on wood in order to avoid bad luck or to continue having good luck.
Which means, to understand how to do something.

Which means, a person or thing that is no longer properly able to function. Also, more specifically, a person in authority, for example a president or prime minister, in their final period of office after a successor has already been elected.
Which means, an introduction, intended to let the audience know that the last person mentioned is not the least important.
Which means, the last of a series of problems, which pushes one's endurance beyond its limits.
Which means, politely ask for someones full attention.
Which means, allow a disagreement or argument to be put in the past.
Which means, avoid restarting a conflict.

Idioms.phrase: Let the cat out of the bag
Idioms.definition: Which means, share a secret that wasn't intended to be shared.
Which means, behave in a free an uninhibited manner. Usually applied to women.
Which means, a suggestion that the thing under consideration has gone along unproductive lines and should be looked at again from the beginning.
Which means, fair competition where no side has an advantage.

Idioms.phrase: Like a chicken with its head cut off
Idioms.definition: Which means, in a frenzied manner.
Which means, the tendency of WWW addresses to become out of date and point to unavailable pages.
Which means, a website that exists primarily to display links to another website, with the intention of improving the search status of the second site.
Which means, to supply or to drink alcoholic drink.
Which means, an exclamation of surprise and annoyance, directed at someone who has behaved badly or performed some kind of prank. Often applied to children.

Idioms.phrase: Little fish in a big pond
Idioms.definition: Which means, someone considered unimportant compared to their more significant peers.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for head.
Which means, old.
Which means, someone who is unpredictable and can cause damage by being reckless.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for bed.
Which means, overcome by emotion and out of control.
Which means, lose an ability that you used to possess.
Which means, a type of mushroom with hallucinogenic properties - sometimes known as 'shrooms'.
Which means, cause a disturbance.
Which means, to state a fact so there are no doubts about it.
Which means, a shed or some other retreat that men decorate in the way they choose (with or without their male friends) and use to relax in traditional male pursuits.
Which means, a toast given to someone on their birthday.
Which means, a discount price offered to friends.
Which means, i'm to blame.
Which means, dried banana peel, used as an intoxicant.
Which means, conventionally minded and dressed men who hold positions of authority. Also called just 'suits'.
Which means, odd actions that appear meaningless but are done for a good reason.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for eyes.
Which means, an admonition not to swear.
Which means, missed the chance to take an opportunity.
Which means, traditional English name for a cleaning woman.
Which means, nonsense or meaningless speech.
Which means, keep quiet. Say nothing.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for deaf.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for mate.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for duchess.
Which means, to perform something particularly well.
Which means, savings set aside for future use.
Which means, a utopian dreamland.
Which means, colloquial term for a new-born baby.
Which means, someone new to the group or area.
Which means, a short space of time.
Which means, a standard office day, between 9am and 5pm. Often used to denote the boring nature of the weekly working routine.
Which means, the inadvertent exposure of a womans nipple.
Which means, the important aspects of a situation; the heart of the matter.
Which means, a refusal to accept a proposition.

Idioms.phrase: No room to swing a cat
Idioms.definition: Which means, an awkward or confined space.
Which means, said to someone to indicate that you aren't in a hurry for them to complete their task.
Which means, someone who might claim to be of good behaviour but has in fact a sordid past.
Which means, said of people who are no longer young but may behave as though they were.
Which means, investigate in an off-hand manner.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for mouth.
Which means, not in possession of one's mental faculties.

Idioms.phrase: Not playing with a full deck
Idioms.definition: Which means, someone who lacks intelligence.
Which means, crazy; out of one's mind.
Which means, no longer having to deal with something.
Which means, something said in confidence that the one speaking doesn't want repeated.
Which means, a story that has been told repeatedly and which has lost any originality.
Which means, faced with a hopeless situation, even after making one's best efforts.
